question: 仰々しい
sourceMnemonic: You <kanji>look up to</kanji> someone... twice. That's too many times that you're looking up to someone. They must be pretty amazing for that to happen. Really, though, you're being fooled. This person is <vocabulary>pompous</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>exaggerated</vocabulary>. So you think they're cool, but really they're pretending to be more than they are.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji, x2 with a <ja>しい</ja> added on for good measure.
